result.execSummary:
The defendant Nicholas Scott Schneider was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-THC (<=200 grams), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superAgency.name: District Attorney
superAgency.notes: AMENDED 02-01-2016.  DAGPA extended for 1 year making this a 3 year agreement.

miscConds.notes:
1) The defendant will have no further contacts w/law enforcement during term of agrmt. that give rise to probable cause for arrest due to criminal conduct.
2)Defendant shall notify Pepin County District Attorney's Office of any change of residence or employment.
3)One month prior to completion of contract, defendant must contact Pepin County District Attorney's Office for a final interview.
4)Report in person as requested by the Pepin County District Attorney or other supervisor designated by him.
5) The defendant must follow the rules and regulations as set forth by probation in 14CM75.
ADDITIONAL CONDITIONS:
A.  Blank

Pay costs and County Appointed Attorney Fees TBD as previously ordered in the amount of $100.00 per month with next payment due on or before 06-01-2017.
AMENDED 05-22-2017:  County Appointed Attorney Fees Ordered for services rendered as follows:  11-29-2016 through 12-13-2016 in the amount of $238.00.  1-24-2017 through 5-16-2017 in the amount of $917.00 for a total amount due of $1155.00.  Defendant to be credited for Attorney Fees on deposit.
If Probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental agencies for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Nicholas Scott Schneider

records.addlTxt: DOC - Notice of Case Status Change Slip - Discharge

Civil rights restored:  
1. The right to vote.
2. The obligation for jury duty.
The following civil rights are not restored to you:
1. Firearms may not be used or possessed unless a pardon, which does not restrict possession of firearms, is
received from the governor.
2. Public office cannot be held unless a pardon is obtained from the governor.

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: Sentencing hearing on May 16, 2017 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Nicholas Scott Schneider in court with attorney Allan L Morgan.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Last court date Court allowed us time to check into drug court.  He is eligible and accepted in drug court in Dunn County.  State notes PSI recommended 36 mos. probation but an alternative sentence for court to consider is prison sentence.  State's current position is prison sentence.  Defense counsel informs he went through in-patient treatment program, going through out-patient program now, TAD through Dunn Co., and ask court for an imposed & stayed sentence and continue with treatment program.  State closing argument/recommendation of prison sentence.  Court notes TAD is a grant used for programs like drug court and pre-trial diversion, don't know if they allow someone sentenced into a diversion program.  Court makes a phone call to Dunn County TAD program to inquire of their program but was unable to reach anyone.  Court continues matter upon hearing back from Dunn County.  Off record.
Sentencing hearing on May 8, 2017 at 09:00 am.
No possession or use of controlled substance without a prescription.

Defendant Nicholas Scott Schneider in court with attorney Allan L Morgan.   Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Counsel received PSI, no corrections.  Called & Sworn by Atty Morgan A.K.S.  Matter adjourned to allow defendant and Mr. Morgan to check into Drug Court in Dunn County.  Bond condition set:  no possession or use of controlled substance without a prescription.  Referred to scheduling clerk for date 45-60 days out.

Interim Order for Compensation of Court Appointed Atty. Ordered that $238.00 be allowed to said atty as compensation of his professional service and disbursements to date.  Dates of Service:  11/28/16 to 12/15/16.
Petition for Payment of County Appointed Attorney Fees of $238.00
Sentencing hearing on February 27, 2017 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Nicholas Scott Schneider in court with attorney Allan L Morgan.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Motion to revoke DPA.  Arguments by counsel.  Court finds grounds exists, revoke the DPA and find defendant guilty.  PSI requested.  Referred to scheduling clerk for sentencing date @ 45 days out.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection
Motion hearing on December 13, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Ordered that Attorney Allan Morgan is appointed to represent the defendant as defense counsel.
Further Ordered That the defendant shall reimburse the County by monthly installments of $100.00 per month commencing 12-12-2016, subsequent payments due the same day of each and every month thereafter.
Failure to make scheduled payments without a showing by the defendant of good cause shall be contempt of court punishable under Ch. 785, Wis. Stats. and the Court shall do any of the following:  See Order

Defendant Nicholas Scott Schneider in court.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Motion to revoke DPA for failure to complete community service and new charges filed in Chippewa County.  Defendant appears w/o an attorney, didn't qualify for PD atty, requests County Appt'd Atty.  Court informs not a free atty, appoints Atty Allan Morgan and repayment to county of $100/mo. com. 12/12/16.  Referred to scheduling clerk to set MH date to work with Atty Morgan's schedule.
Motion hearing on November 28, 2016 at 02:45 pm.
Motion to Revoke Deferred Acceptance of Guilty or No Contest Plea Agreement

Buffalo-Pepin Counties CJCC Termination of C/S.  Buffalo-Pepin Counties CJCC Termination of C/S for failure to comply with the program.  The defendant has not completed the assigned community service.
Additional Conditions of Deferred Acceptance of Guilty or No Contest Plea Agreement

Defendant Nicholas Scott Schneider in court with attorney Roger M. Hillestad.  Defendant Nicholas Scott Schneider in custody.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Agreement reached.  State withdraws Motion to Revoke.  Counsel requests court approve modification of original DAGPA.  Court amends DPA & approves extension of 1 year.
Atty Roger Hillestad appointed.
Motion hearing at 02-01-2016 11:00 am

Order to Transport.
The warden/superintendent with physical custody of the person subject to this order at the time of its execution shall make that person available to the sheriff of Pepin County.  The sheriff shall convey that person to 740 7th Avenue West for proceedings in the Circuit Court of Pepin County on  February 1, 2016 at 11:00 a.m.
Letter from Atty Huff advising he no longer represents Nicholas Schneider.

Order to Transport.
The warden/superintendent with physical custody of the person subject to this order at the time of its execution shall make that person available to the sheriff of Pepin County.  The sheriff shall convey that person to 740 7th Avenue West for proceedings in the Circuit Court of Pepin County on  February 1, 2016 at 1:30 p.m.
Motion hearing at 02-01-2016 01:30 pm

Order to Transport.
The warden/superintendent with physical custody of the person subject to this order at the time of its execution shall make that person available to the sheriff of Pepin County.  The sheriff shall convey that person to 740 7th Avenue West for proceedings in the Circuit Court of Pepin County on  January 25, 2016 at 10:30 a.m.
Motion hearing at 01-25-2016 10:30 am
Notice of Motion and Motion to Revoke Deferred Acceptance of Guilty or No Contest Plea Agreement.
Letter from Judge Duvall to counsel re: Mr. Huff's letter dated March 13, 2015.
Letter from Atty Huff requesting the Motion to Modify Sentence be reopened and a hearing be scheduled.
Character letters
Deferred Acceptance of Guilty Plea Agreement
Waiver form filed.

Defendant Nicholas Scott Schneider in court with attorney Charles S. Huff.   Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State informs court of plea agreement.  Defendant will plead to count 1 and enter into DAGPA for 2 yrs.  Defendant will plead to Counts 2 & 3 under new complaint with joint recommendation of 2 yrs. probation and counsel free to argue jail with State capping it at 120 days.  Defendant waives right to P.H., files waiver form with court.  Court shows P.H. waived, bind over for trial.  Information contains single count 1.  Court advises defendant of charge/max. penalties & rights, reviews DPA, advises defendant of felony prohibitions if agreement revoked.  Defendant pleads guilty to Count 1.  Court defers acceptance and approves DPA.  Counts 2 & 3 now Counts 1 & 2 of new complaint.  Court advises defendant of charges/max. penalties.  Defendant pleads guilty to each count,  Court finds his WCR & Plea done K&V, accepts pleas and finds defendant guilty.  Counsel argues jail time.  2 on misdemeanors, court withholds sentence & places defendant on 2 yrs. probation with conditions.

Adjourned initial appearance on December 16, 2014 at 10:30 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on December 16, 2014 at 10:30 am.
Cont'd.
